ChickenTikkaMasala.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 500g chicken breast or thighs (boneless, cut into cubes), 1/2 cup plain yogurt, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon paprika (for colour) 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon garam masala,  Salt to taste, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil,  2 tablespoons butter or oil,  1 large onion, finely chopped,  2 medium tomatoes, pureed , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste ,   1 teaspoon ground cumin,  1 teaspoon ground coriander , 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon garam masala,  1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,  1/2 cup heavy cream ,  Fresh coriander leaves (for garnish),  Salt to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, garam masala, salt, and vegetable oil. Add the chicken pieces, coat them well, and marinate for at least 1 hour (preferably overnight for better flavour).

Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F).  Place the marinated chicken on a baking tray and bake for 15-20 minutes or grill until fully cooked. Alternatively, you can cook the chicken in a hot pan with a little oil until golden on the outside and cooked through.

In a large pan, melt butter or heat oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears. Add the tomato puree and cook for 5-7 minutes until the oil separates from the mixture.
Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala. Stir and cook for another minute.
Add water as needed to adjust the consistency of the gravy. Pour in the cream and mix well. Simmer for 5 minutes on low heat.
Add the cooked chicken pieces to the gravy. Let it simmer for another 5-10 minutes to absorb all the Flavors. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan, roti, or steamed basmati rice.

ButterChicken.name: Butter Chicken
ButterChicken.inngredients: 500g chicken breast or thighs (boneless, cut into cubes), 1/2 cup plain yogurt,  1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,  1 tablespoon lemon juice,  1 teaspoon ground cumin,  1 teaspoon ground coriander,  1 teaspoon garam masala,  1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,  1 teaspoon chili powder (adjust to taste), Salt to taste, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 tablespoons butter,  1 large onion, finely chopped, 2 medium tomatoes, pureed,  1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,  1/2 cup heavy cream,  1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 2 tablespoons cashew paste (optional),  Salt to taste, Fresh coriander for garnish
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, chili powder, salt, and oil. Add the chicken cubes, coat well, and marinate for at least 1 hour (preferably overnight for better flavour).

Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F). Place the marinated chicken on a baking tray and bake for 15-20 minutes or grill until fully cooked. Alternatively, you can cook the chicken in a hot pan with a little oil until golden on the outside and cooked through.

In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears. Add the tomato puree and cook until oil starts to separate (about 5-7 minutes).
Add cumin, coriander, chili powder, turmeric, and garam masala. Stir well. Add cashew paste if using, and cook for another 2 minutes. Pour in the cream and mix well. Simmer for 5 minutes on low heat.
Add the cooked chicken to the gravy. Let it simmer for 5-10 minutes, allowing the chicken to absorb the flavours.
Garnish with fresh coriander. Serve hot with naan, roti, or steamed basmati rice.

Palak Chicken.name: Palak Chicken
Palak Chicken.inngredients: 500g chicken (bone-in or boneless, cut into pieces), 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1 teaspoon garam masala, Salt to taste, 200g fresh spinach leaves, 1 large onion, finely chopped, 2 tomatoes, finely chopped or pureed,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 2 green chilies (optional, for extra heat),1 teaspoon ground coriander,1/2 teaspoon garam masala, 1 teaspoon kasseri Methi (dried fenugreek leaves),2 tablespoons cream or yogurt (optional), Salt to taste, 2 tablespoons oil or ghee.
instructions: Wash the spinach thoroughly. Boil water in a large pot and blanch the spinach for 2-3 minutes. Immediately transfer the spinach to ice-cold water to retain the green color.  Drain and blend the spinach into a smooth puree. Set aside.

In a bowl, mix the chicken with ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground coriander, garam masala, and salt. Heat oil or ghee in a large pan, and fry the marinated chicken until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add cumin seeds and let them sizzle. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes (or tomato puree) and cook until the oil starts separating.  Add green chilies (if using), ground coriander, and salt. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the cooked chicken pieces back into the pan and stir. Add the spinach puree and Kasseri Methi. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes, allowing the Flavors to blend.
Add cream or yogurt for a richer texture (optional). Sprinkle garam masala and mix well.  Serve hot with roti, naan, or steamed rice.
